name: BBCWorld
text:
The official Covid-19 death toll worldwide is above 440,000

But in 27 countries alone, the BBC found at least 130,000 more excess deaths during the pandemic that were not directly attributed to coronavirus

[Thread]

https://t.co/fPj0W21Lo7

name: BBCWorld
text:
Taking the total number of deaths from all causes, and removing the number of expected deaths in the period plus the number officially recorded as Covid-19 deaths, we can calculate excess deaths

https://t.co/fPj0W21Lo7 https://t.co/LuqY7VIU4t

name: BBCWorld
text:
The number of deaths in the UK has been 43% higher than average, with about 64,500 more people dying than usual

London has recorded the highest number of excess deaths during the pandemic

https://t.co/fPj0W21Lo7 https://t.co/cXvIC1wH5Q

name: BBCWorld
text:
Ecuador has registered twice as many deaths in the months of March to May compared with previous years, with about 19,500 more people dying than usual

Only 3,358 deaths have been recorded as Covid-19 in this period

https://t.co/fPj0W21Lo7 https://t.co/TZaJ2kAb2J

name: BBCWorld
text:
In Spain, deaths have been about 50% higher than average, with around 42,900 more people dying than usual

Madrid has reported the highest levels of excess deaths in the country

https://t.co/fPj0W21Lo7 https://t.co/s6tmRrRXZz

name: BBCWorld
text:
South Africa is an exception - it saw fewer deaths overall during the pandemic

A strict lockdown meant less deaths from events like traffic accidents

The number of deaths has been 9% lower than average, with about 7,400 fewer people dying

https://t.co/fPj0W21Lo7 https://t.co/uU5BlHk4X0

name: BBCWorld
text:
The US has reported the world's largest official death toll from coronavirus

The number of deaths in the country has been 16% higher than average, with more than 26,000 excess deaths

New York City has been hardest hit, but all states have been affected

https://t.co/fPj0W21Lo7 https://t.co/szbQ0DO1v4

name: BBCWorld
text:
Coronavirus has claimed thousands of lives around the world, and remains a threat 
 
Understanding how deadly it is, and it's impact on populations, is critically important 

Read more of the @BBCNews research: https://t.co/fPj0W21Lo7
